intro: Compsoa latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf compsoa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in wetlands or near water sources. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in tropical and subtropical areas.
